intro: Memecylon protrusum, commonly known as the creeping memecylon, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
